snippet: A report on hotel loyalty programs, expected to be released Tuesday, evaluates dissatisfaction levels by business travelers.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column notes a report from CG42 on hotel loyalty programs evaluates dissatisfaction levels by business travelers; points out travelers frustrated with their primary hotel programs are projected to move more than $10 billion in spending in 2012 to competing programs.
lead_paragraph: A report on hotel loyalty programs, expected to be released Tuesday, evaluates dissatisfaction levels by business travelers.

headline.print_headline: Frustrated With Your Hotel? No Need to Be Loyal
headline.seo: Unhappy Travelers Can Swap Out of Hotel Loyalty Programs
headline.main: Frustrated With Your Hotel? No Need to Be Loyal
